prompt:
Nurse: well so Great, thank you, Mr. O'Leary. I hope your day is going well so far. Can you share a bit about how you've been feeling today?

Patient: I'm pretty mad, honestly.

Nurse: I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling upset, Mr. O'Leary. Would you like to share what's been bothering you?

Patient: Not really.

Nurse: I see, Mr. O'Leary. I'm here to help you with any concerns you might have about your upcoming procedure. It's completely normal to feel a bit anxious before a major procedure. You must be looking forward to getting a new knee. Do you have any plans for what you'd like to do once you've recovered from your knee replacement?

Patient: No. I just wanna feel better.

Nurse: I can certainly appreciate that, Mr. O'Leary. The goal of this procedure is indeed to help you feel better and improve your quality of life. How are you feeling about the procedure itself?

Patient: I guess I feel fine.

responses.gpt4: That's good to hear. It's important to remember that it's completely normal to have questions or concerns about an operation like this. Our team will be there to guide you through each step of the process, from preparation to recovery. If you have any questions at any time, don't hesitate to speak up.
responses.our_model: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. O'Leary. It's a positive step towards improving your health. Before we delve into the details, do you have any specific questions or concerns you'd like to discuss?
